official-title.#text: Supporting the designation of a week as National Federal Nurse Recognition Week.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: supports the designation of National Federal Nurse Recognition Week;

commends Federal nurses as integral in supporting the Federal Government’s mission to provide
			 quality, accessible and affordable health care; and

recognizes the need to ensure that we maintain an adequate number of well-trained Federal nurses
			 and provide them with the support they need to provide the highest quality
			 patient care.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is the largest employer of nurses in the Nation and
			 veterans rely on more than 80,000 nurses to provide care in over 1,400
			 sites, including medical centers, outpatient clinics, nursing homes and in
			 veterans’ homes;

text.#text: Whereas military men and women and their families rely on nurses in the

Whereas Federal nurses are regularly called upon to provide services in extremely challenging
			 environments, including periods of war and natural disasters;

Whereas Federal nurses maintain their unwavering dedication and professional competence in the face
			 of growing demand for services;

Whereas the majority of Federal nurses are female and many are the sole breadwinners of their
			 families; and

Whereas it is in the national interest to have a robust and well-trained Federal nurse workforce to
			 meet growing health care needs: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 778 IH: Supporting the designation of a week as National Federal Nurse Recognition Week.
